did.abstract: George W. French served as 1st Lieutenant of the Michigan 10th Cavalry from 1864-1865 in the Union army. The collection includes materials related to his wartime activates as well as post-war correspondences and forms.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: Donated by Nina N. Ness (donor no. 4567), in 1974; and by Shirley A. Smith (donor no. 11296), in August, 2015.

accruals.p: No further additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open without restriction.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, George W. French Papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Born in 1829, George W. French enlisted in the Michigan 10th Cavalry in Grand Rapids, MI in 1863. In April of 1864 he was promoted to 1st Lieutenant and continued to serve in this position until the war's end when he was mustered out in November of 1865 at Memphis, TN. He died in 1895 in Muir, Michigan, and is buried there at Oakwood Cemetery.

scopecontent.p: The George W. French Papers consist of wartime records of the Michigan 10th Cavalry dating from 1863 to 1865. Included are lists of quartermaster stores, requisition forms, and other supply documents of the 10th Michigan Cavalry and 8th and 9th Tennessee Cavalry. Also French's Officer Commission signed by Michigan Governor Austin Blair. Post-war documents include personal correspondence, French's military pension forms, and other assorted personal papers dating to 1906.
